distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for openvpn fixes the following issues:

- It was possible to trigger an assertion by sending a malformed IPv6 packet.
  That issue could have been abused to remotely shutdown an openvpn server or
  client, if IPv6 and --mssfix were enabled and if the IPv6 networks used
  inside the VPN were known. [bsc#1044947, CVE-2017-7508]
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: OpenVPN versions before 2.4.3 and before 2.3.17 are vulnerable to remote denial-of-service when receiving malformed IPv6 packet.
notes.title: CVE description
